title: Project Euler
description: A website dedicated to the fascinating world of mathematics and programming.

title: Recent Article
description:
You may have noticed that the website became a little sluggish recently or you may have received MySQL connection errors whilst trying to view pages. It seems that this is due to a wonderful article written by James Somers for the technology section of the online magazine, theAtlantic, which presented Project Euler in a very positive light:

How I Failed, Failed, and Finally Succeeded at Learning How to Code

Obviously we could only be very grateful to James Somers for writing the article as it has clearly attracted a large number of new members. However, the downside was that the website began to strain under the load which is why you will have noted the problems in navigating the website.

Our hosts have worked to help us with this, but as a temporary measure I have also removed the feature which displays the number of users currently online, which was regularly showing figures over 200 during the past couple of days. The result is that we are almost back to normal speeds. With a rethink in the way it is implemented I hope to be able to re-enable the "users online" feature in the future.

In the meantime, the Project Euler team would like to thank James Somers for his article and we would like to extend a very special welcome to any new members who have joined us recently.

(Tuesday 07 June 2011: Recent Article)
